Pre-Game Insights: New Zealand are currently unbeaten, having defeated England in the tournament opener and then clinching victory against Netherlands to make it back-to-back.
Last edition's runners-up, New Zealand began their campaign with a nine-wicket victory against England in Ahmedabad.
New Zealand made it two out of two against Netherlands, winning by 99 runs.
On the other hand, Bangladesh have been erratic and began their campaign with a six-wicket win vs Afghanistan.
But then Bangladesh crashed to a heavy defeat in their next fixture, losing by 137 runs against England.
Miscellaneous Highlights: New Zealand broke Bangladesh's long standing home winning streak in ODIs last month, when they clinched a 2-0 series win in Dhaka
